Title.evidence: BASIL-2: A Randomised Controlled Trial of Revascularization Strategies in CLTI

Trial_Design.evidence: BASIL-2 was an open-label, multicentre, phase 3 randomised controlled trial

Participants.evidence: conducted in 41 vascular surgery units in the UK, Sweden, and Denmark

Intervention.evidence: vein bypass (VB) first versus a best endovascular treatment (BET) first revascularization strategy

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the cost-effectiveness and cost-utility

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was amputation-free survival (AFS) over a 2- to 7-year follow-up

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 345 participants were randomised (172 to VB-first, 173 to BET-first) between July 2014 and November 2020

Result_Outcome.evidence: BET-first showing lower costs (–£2,524, 95% CI –£5,845 to £1,132)

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered with ISRCTN27728689
